text: Bottle. Pours amber with minimum head. Aroma: hay, herbs, caramel, some medicine, sweetish, berries, plums. Taste: sweetish with some bitterness, caramel, herbal, hay, some pine and woodiness. Medium body. Bitter long finish. Nice.
clear amber liquid with white head. aroma of caramel, berries. medium sweetness, very bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

Draft at Festival der Bierkulturen, Cologne. Hazy amber brown with a small tan head. Aroma of malt, caramel, overripe dark fruits and light fruits. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at home, in Biervana glass, 6th May 17. Pours copper with a slight haze. Aroma is lightl caramel, yeast, earthy. Taste is grassy, earthy, malt, faint caramel, light bitterness. Very tasty gear, as expected from two great breweries.

Bottle from Craft Beer Store, Hamburg. Hazy brown with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dark malts and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. High drinkability. 300417

330ml bottle from Boxbeers.com / L01717 / BBE JUL17


Clear copper colour with a white head. Malts, bread, caramel, biscuit, potato cellar, earthy.

Sticke swing-top bottle 33cl. poured into an alt glass. Hazy medium amber, good two finger macropore off-white head, good retention, light lacing; aroma toasted malts, caramel, treacle, rye bread, hay; taste light heavy sweet and light bitter, toasted malts, toffee, rye bread, fruity hints; malty sweetbitter aftertaste, dry bitter finish, grassy and pine notes, bit husky; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; fresh and tasty, very nice.
Cloudy amber with a medium white head. Aroma had toasted malt, noble hops and hints of caramel. Flavor was quite dry with toasted alt, citric and grassy notes. Finished dry an bitter.
Tap at gingerman, reddish brown pour. Nose is caramel and earthy. Tastes of berry, caramel, earth, bready, dates. Smooth palate. Bit of pepper on finish.
Brown, clear with small offwhite head. Caramely, hoppy aroma. Notes of tea. Flavour has caramel and hoppy, slightly citrusy, grassy bitter bite.
0,33l Flasche. Braunes Bier mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Röstmalze und Honig. Im Geschmack eine interessante Mischung aus frischem grünen Hopfen und Röstmalze. Lecker!

330ml bottle (Gambrinus Degustation, Tartu)
Right on opening, its a dusty aroma, in the glass its a non-sweet rye-bread, just a few berries baked in. Full palate, pleasant carbonation. Nice dry bitter finish - old browned hops. Mellow malty brew, like it.
Keg at Red Hot. Pours deep reddish brown, nose is caramel, toffee, light fruit, taste is sweet, caramel, citrus, quite fruity.

Bottle from Maracuja05, thanks! Dark amber color. Malt, fresh hops, tea leaves and a hint of citrus in the aroma. Malty yet dry flavor, hoppy with a hint of citrus, tea leaves. Long aftertaste. Brilliant, well balanced alt.

Thanks erzengel!! Pours a copper color with a tan head. The smell is toasted malt, green hops, some underlying fruit and caramel. The taste is quite hoppy and sharp up front. Green hops, resin, caramel ending bitter. Light+ in body with average carbonation.

Not my favorite Uerige at all.

Sieht aus wie Alt, riecht wie IPA, im Mund dominiert klar der Grünhopfen, das altbiertypische Malzaroma tritt zurück und kommt erst im Abgang zur Geltung. Lecker, aber für meinen Geschmack könnte der Hopfen etwas sparsamer dosiert werden.
Draft. Hazed brown pour. Aroma is herbal and low. Flavor is nice. Has a good dryness. German style ipa.

Pours a hazelnut brown color with a medium sized, stable eggshell head.

Has aromas of ripe orange fruits, fresh herbs, a tad of grass and lots of rustic caramel malts. 

Drinks very soft, with a soothing, well nuanced carbonation, while the beer showcases a convincing balance between being malty sweet and herbal dry.

Tastes of toasted nuts and forest earth, together with whole grain bread and an early hop dryness, which not only consists of a herbal quality but also includes a ripe orange fruit note. Turns even breadier then, with the malts adding a sweet quality to the taste, which vanishes during the finish, in which the beer regains its herbal hoppiness, exhibiting a long lasting dryness, still coated by the malts.

Utmost flavorful and intense, well build with even more hop depth than many batches of the regular Sticke. Its carbonation though is almost a little too low and I am not a big fan of the enhanced malt sweetness, which is unusual for Uerige.

At Wurst & Bier - Dark brown beer with off-white head. Dark roasted malt characteristics mingle with hazy green hops on the tongue. body is slightly sweet, caramel. dry bitter finish. something to roll around in your mouth.
Farbe Kastanie, leicht trüb. Stabiler Schaum. Geruch kräuterig, leicht grasif. Ausgewogen süßlich, mit Karamell. Auf der Zunge leicht betäubend. Nachhängende Bittere.

(Tap) Die Farbe ist hellbraun, es ist leicht trüb mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist breit, mit dunklem Malz, leicht angebranntes Karamell und dezent mit Hefe. Im Geschmack ist es holzig, mit fast leichtem Keller Aromen, Tannenzapfen und einer leichten Säure. Zudem kommt Bittere im Abgang.
Brown, small head, aroma of chocolate, nice, caramel, flavor of chocolate, bitter, sourish, fun, fresh, medium bodied.

Erstmal muss die tolle Flasche erwähnt werden, sehr gelungen! Optisch Spezibraun, in der Nase sehr malzig. Im Trunk etwas alkoholisch, bitter, hintenweg leichte Süße. Langer Nachhall. Kein Kastenbier, definitiv nicht, eher ein Absacker.
[backlog] 04-04-16 // bottle at home. Pours a deep brown colour. Small white head. Hoppy nose. Moderate malty. Then quite strong hop notes. Some pine, grass, wood. Nice hoppy approach to an Altbier.

Bottle shared at the chriso and Ruth pre GBBF Shindig 2016 - London. Day 1. Pours clouded amber with a creamy head. Sweet, with grainy toast, light piney accents. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Fairly simple bready, grainy finish. Pretty good stuff.

Bottle @ Chriso pre-GBBF Shindig 2016. Pours a slightly hazy amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty caramel hoppy aroma. Fruity malty caramel hoppy flavor with some bitter hints. Has a fruity malty spicy hoppy caramel finish.

6th August 2016The great ChrisO pre GBBF gathering. Clear dark amber beer, tidy cream colour head. Palate is light, mildly dry. Reasonable carbonation. Smooth tangy malts, tangy caramel - toffee. Modest spice and bitterness. Mild dark fruits. Not bad.

Chris and Ruths Shindig 2016, Saturday. Hazy amber beer with a nice offwhite head. Malty caramel aroma, grapes, chocolate, some biscuits. Malty caramel flavor, grapes, citrus, some biscuits. Ok beer.

330ml bottle. Minimally cloudy, chestnut colour with slightly late awakening, average, thick, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, minimalyl lacing, off-white head. Nuttily, toasty malty aroma, fresh, grassy hoppy overtones, subtle hints of malt lozenge. Taste is initially dry, hoppy and toasty, nuttily malty, grassy hop notes, a touch of mint, later malty hints of caramel and toffee gain weight and bring along some sweetness and a touch of malt lozenge; the flavours eventually find together in good harmony in a creamy finish.
Bottle shared at Chris and Ruths pre GBBF shindig; dark amber pour with an off white head, aroma has some sweet malts, taste has stewed red fruits, some sweet malts.

Bottle 330ml. w. swing top @ home on the terrace. [ As Uerige/Kehrwieder Jrön Grünhopfen-Sticke ].[ Trade by Beerhunter111 ]. Unclear - hazy matt medium to dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, caramel, hay, moderate to heavy hoppy, pine, spruce, grass, wood. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, licorice wood, grass, pine, sweet malt, dark malt, caramel, medium dry. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. IMO quit odd, but in the nice way and very easy to drink ;D [20160528]

Dark amber, little lace.
Full body, dense flavor, very hot and bright mouthfeel, long, dry aftertaste.
Very bitter, dry, crisp.
Lots of hop, resin, caramel, yeast.
Very nice beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy copper with almost no head. Aroma is fig pudding, tatnines, caramel and walnuts, some smoke as well. Taste is some booze, dark fruity sweetness and carbonation induced sourness, and spicyness. Finish is more booze and some toothpaste. Velvety soothing mouthfeel. I am still not sure whether I like this or not.
Bottle. Dark brown with a golden glow, offwhite lace. Spicy, honey, orange blossom, perfumed. Medium body, mellow mouthfeel. Roast, honey, broad hop accents, light berries, roast. Great.
Bottle, 6.2%. Unclear dark brown with medium tan head. Aroma is malt, hop, grass and caramel. Flavour is malt, caramel, toasted, dark fruit, little bread, hops, grass, medium sweet and medium bitter.

At a tasting, thanks, smallish bubbly head, cloudy slightly murky brown color with red hues, aroma of nuts, caramel and woody hints and something stale in the back, bready caramelly flavor with a slightly coarse soapy bitterness and a sour hint. Drinkable but not fresh.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Vova. Amber-brown with a beige head. Aroma of malt, toast, and "green" hops, slightly stale. Flavor has sweetish malt, toast, a bit of nuts, and bitter hops. Medium-bodied. Could be fresher, but still quite pleasant.

330ml bottle, from trade with Erzengel, many thanks! Pours murky brown, thin ring of off-white head. Aroma is sweet malt, light tobacco. Taste is murky, swirls of sweetness, dried fruits, echoes of liquorice, decent alt.

Bottle poured into Spiegelau IPA glass poures hazy brown with low half a Finger of off white head. Nose is low intense hops but decent amount of dryed fruit, plums, raisins or such... Taste is on the dryed fruit side too. If you know the dopple sticke you clearly See the relation between them. Overall a nice beer, but nothing to call your grandma for. Schumacher 1838 does the whole thing hell of alot better...

Gingerman, NYC tap: pours brown with a small beige head. Aroma is lots of earthy malts, light bit of hops. Taste is malty and lightly sweet. Bitter finish. Not super thick but a bit on the sticky side of things. Kind of tangy at the end. Good but not all that great.

Dunkelbrun, leicht trüb mit hellem wenig beständigem Schaum. Das Bier duftet ganz toll mit karamelligen, harzig kräuterigen und leicht holzigen Aromen. Kräuterig, malzig karamellig und hopfenbitter gestaltet sich dann der Antrunk, bevor die Röstmalzaromen übernehmen und einen herben, leicht bitteren und langen Abgang einläuten.

Klasse Bier!

I agree with oakes. Not sure what is going on with this but Im left with a flat, wooden taste here. Nothing like Ueriges other beers. Amber pour with ok head. Some booze and odd mash malt aroma. Asrtingent finish. Tap at Churchkey.

hazy brown with a small, fine head. amazing aroma of caramel, red fruit and herbal hops. pine becoming dominant after some minutes. well-balanced taste. good, long finish. seems like this is as good as altbier can get.
Tolles Alt-Bier, das ich da geschenkt bekommen habe. (Danke, liebe Almut!) Gut spritzig, Schöne dunkle Farbe. Recht herb, schön bitter. Ganz mein Geschmack.

Flasche 33cl. Interessantes humoriges Etikett! Harziger, fast beißbarer Hopfengeschmack, überraschend weicher Abgang. Röstaromen sehr dezent im Hintergrund, Hopfen dominiert alles. Ragt weit in den Hals hinein!
Draft at Churchkey. Clear golden amber color, tan head. Aroma of toasted caramel. Taste is sweetish caramel with a peppery edge. Good example of the style.

@ Tria Taproom, Philadelphia. Turbid chestnut colour. How American of them. Medium head with tight bubbles. Aroma is very hoppy, though more of a grassy, hay-like hop. Has a lot of bitterness. Tastes green, raw, yeasty. Malts are AWOL. So turbid, green-tasting brown ale with none of the sticke magic. I took out a solid ten stickes when I was last in Düsseldorf, but will have to soldier through one of these.

Many thanks for this great Alt to kevnic2008. Piwo ladnie wygladajace, piana trwala srednia, ladna barwa rubinowo miedziana, prezentowalo się to piwo swietnie w nowo sakupionej szklaneczce Alt. Lekko metnawe, dosłownie tylko ciut. Zapach wyraźny, kora, cynamon i wanillia. Smak goździki, cynamon i nuty drzewno przyprawowe. Lekka kwaskowosc, fajne piwo z fajna etykieta. Bardzo wyraziste i dość wytrawne w smaku, mało karmelu. Taki Craft z Dusseldorfu to uwielbiam. Polecam
Flasche from Hopfen & Malz, Berlin. Poured murky greyish amber with a white head. Herbal and green hops with quite some yeast and caramel. Unrefined and raw. Bitter finish. Regular Uerige please!

L:
-pours a clear deep copper with a big,foamy,offwhite head
-medium carbonation visible
S:
-grassy,nutty,roasted chestnuts,caramel,earthy,raisins,herbs
T:
-rose hip,grassy,caramel,roasted chestnut,raisins,herbs,brown bread
-low bitterniss for the style
F:
-low to medium carbonation
-medium body
-alcohol well hidden
O:
Less fruity and less hoppy than the regular Sticke with caramel and bready notes dominating.
Very good overall, but i like the regular Sticke better.

Bottle: Amber color, creamy off-white head. Aroma is malty, caramelic and light roasty with a nice grassy/fruity hop note. Flavor is also malty and caramelic, light sugar notes, ends roasty and hoppy. Good.

(Uerige / Kehrwieder Jrön Grünhopfen-Sticke) Swing top bittle 330 ml, thanks to Beerhunter111! Served into an alt glass at home, ABV 6.2%
Brown coloured body, clear, with a big and quite thick tan head on top, with good retention too.
Aroma of caramel malts with good hops presence.
Nice taste too, caramel, toasted malts, orange, faint citrus, biscuit. Begins sweet but there is satysfying bitter finish here.
Medium body with good carbonation, sticky palate.
Good.

Aroma: roasted malts, herbs, crunchy bread skin, melanoidines.
Appearance: hazy brown color and beige head.
Taste: medium herbal bitterness, roasted caramel, dark malts, crunchy bread skin, nice fresh herbal notes, dry.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation, herbal and roasted finish.
Overall: Amazing sticke, really fresh herbal taste and balanced.

330 ml bottle from Biervana München, bb Jul. 16.
Deep copper-brown body, with a big, creamy, moderately lacing, beige head.
Aroma of sweet berries, grass, herbs, toast, caramel.
Tastes of caramel, sweet fruits, grass, bread, citrus, candy, some herbs.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, zesty, a bit piney, grassy, a bit herbal, moderate sweet.

Nice one. Well balanced between sweet fruits, smooth malts and medium bitter hoppy notes, although the hops are a bit in the background. Interesting beer, but not the best one from both brewers.

0,33l bottle at home shared by Saeglopur, big thanks. BB 07/2016. brownish very murky color, small off-white head. smells of dried fruits, plums, bit glueish, light sweetness, honey, decent smell. light to medium body, very light carbonation (not to say almost none existent), slick mouthfeel. tastes of dried fruits, wet grass, honey, peppery, spices, plums, tobacco, light buttery. finishes lightly bitter with notes of tobacco, bit buttery and some dried fruits. OKish, but not the biggest fan.

Coole Kombination. Drei Mal durfte ich es trinken, dieses einzigartig Gesöff. Vom Hahn beim Norderstedter Craft Beer Day 2016 und in der Schankwirtschaft HH. Aus der Flasche leider bisher nur einmal. Aber mit der Flasche muss ich hier beginnen. Schaut selbst, welch ein Design. Hämmerhead!!! Der Geruch dann so wie man es sich erhofft, hoppy & malzig süss. Der Trunk macht auch alles richtig, kombiniert geschickt und komplex die Hopfen im Alten. LÄGGER!!!!
Pours a deep brown in color with a light tan, small head. Aroma was light toffe, with very slight hoppy notes
33 cl bottle. Pours hazy brown with a small tan head. Aroma is grainy, toasted and grassy to straw. Toasted, grainy and breadish. Dry, bitetr and solid hoppy. Breadish finish.

Aroma and taste comprises sweet malts, some dark dried fruit, notes of caramel and treacle, some nice hoppy backing, overall really like this, good stuff.
33 cl. bottle. Dark hazy amber colour with an off-white gead. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, fruot, caramel and spice.
Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a tan head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, and over ripe fruits, leading to a bitter finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Freiburg; lovely nose of apple compote and then rooms and rooms full of amber honey. Slight metallic edge. Decent taste but for me not as good as announced. Nice wet hops softness and beautifully balanced Altbier honeyroast. Slightly sulphuric yeastiness. Well measured bitterness.

0.33 l bottle from Hopfenrausch, bottled in January 2016. Clear, dark reddish amber with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Sweetish, fruity-grassy and slightly herbal aroma of lemon, grapefruit, some caramel and hints of ginger. Sweetish-malty, slightly fruity taste of caramel, nuts, some molasses, citric hops and grass, followed by a short, medium grassy-bitter finish. Medium body, smooth and slightly oily mouthfeel, almost flat. Much hoppier than the regular Sticke, giving it a refreshing, citric hop character that is far from being over the top, so that the balance is close to perfection. Superbly drinkable of course, underlined with a super-smooth mouthfeel. Great hopped-up Sticke!

Eigentlich ganz nett mit einem leichten Stich an Hopfen und Beeren dahinter. Mildwürzig mit einer pfeffrigen Note und einem prickelnden Hintergrund. Dennoch nicht außergewöhnlich, auch kaum knackig zitronig oder ähnliches. Eher im Bereich der Beerenfrüchte anzusiedeln.

Bottle from Dilo in Bochum. The beer has got a deep dark brown-ligth amber colour with a small head and medium body. Aroma of malt and copper. Taste of malt, copper, barley, bread, caramel and flowers. Malty-hoppy finish with hints of vanilla and fruits.

330 ml bottle. L01816. BBE Juli/16. From a trade with beerhunter111. Thanks a lot Hans Peter!
Slightly cloudy mid-brown color with a small off-white head. 
Malt, sugar, sweetness, metal, mild hops and some bitterness in the aroma. 
The flavor is sweet caramel malt, sugar, dryness, metal, hops and some bitterness. Not bad.

From 0.33L bottle. Pours murky & dark red-brown with an off-white and frothy, average sized head. Aroma is on the one hand heavy malty with hints of dark bread, caramel, roasted malts. On the other hand there are great hoppy notes as well, originating from the fresh harvested (green) hop added as whole umbels. Grass, herbs and pine are present in the aroma. Medium to full body with a medium thick texture, slightly creamy, but also a little too watery for me. Soft to medium carbonation. Flavor full of roasted malt with initial moderate sweetness. Light bitter initial flavor. The long finish is heavily bitter, the hoppy flavors arise, grass and herbs. I really like it. Glad there is another one waiting.

33 cl bottle @ hotel room, Berlin. Aroma has sweet malty tones, caramel and toffee. Flavoyr has toffee, some caramel, sweet malty tones and some grassy hops in the finish. Quite what it promises to be; a hoppy version of Sticke.
How : bottle Appearance almost clear light brown/ redish color. Medium off-white head. Aroma : fresh yeast, spice brown sugar, nuts, caramel, toast. Palate : medium body, average carbonation.

Dark brown body with nice tan head. Very nice hoppy and fruity aroma with some malts and pines. Taste is more malty with some fruits anf biscuits in the background. Aftertaste is nice bitter with some slightly roasted caramel sweetness. Nice one.

0,33l Bügelflasche. Uerige und Kehrwieder, meine Lieblingsbrauereien vereint! Dunkel kastanienfarbenes klares Bier mit beigem cremigem Schaum. Es dftet nach Pinien, Malz, Hopfen und Trockenfrüchten. Komplexer Geschmack. Grüne Haselnüsse, Gewürze, Malz, verbrannter Zucker. Sehr langes Finish.
Dunkle Kastanien Farbe schöner schaum, Geruch harzig holzig Trockenfrüchte, Geschmack malzig herb leichte fruchtige süße, starker schwarztee im Abgang der lang anhält
Brown foam ring. Shy light nutty nose. The taste is bitter and a little weird off. The aftertaste is dry and hoppy.

(draught) murky brownish-ruby colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of gletschereis, peppermint and caramelized malts, with lots of lemon balm and strawberry syrup. flavour is mostly the typical uerige house-character, caramelized malts, herbal hops and strawberries, with a touch of yeast and botanical herbs in the light-bitter finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.
UPDATED: FEB 29, 2016 Bottle, courtesy of Koelschtrinker. Dry hopped indeed, meaty and intense, but not so much of alt left. An odd mix of a bock nose and IPA palate, and it doesnt work well.

Bottle from Beerhunter111 (euro local swap 1/2016), many thanks! Pours dark brown with a white head. Herbal aroma with green leaves, citrus, raisins. Taste follows with spices (a bit rye like), toffee, toast, prunes, light resin, overripe blue grapes. Medium sweet and bitter, creamy, medium body. Nice.
Klares Mahagoni mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, Karamell, fruchtig, Waldhonig, Rosinen, leicht bitter, sehr süffig.

(swing top bottle, 33cl) Hazy, dark brown colour with a beige and firm medium-sized foamy head. Fresh, grassy and resiny hoppy aroma with subtle citric notes, backed by mildly toasted malt and caramel. Bitter-sweet flavour, medium bodied with a well-matured carbonation. Initially malty with caramel, delicately syrupy taste; drying grassy, herbal and mildly resiny hops tuning in quite quickly, accompanied by delicately fruity accents towards the lasting bitter-sweet finish, hints of raspberries retronasal. Balanced and more-ish Sticke. 25.II.16

láhev, čerstvě z balíku od pana doktora - díky moc! Slightly hazy dark chestnut-brown colour with a mid-sized off-white head. Spicy-hoppy nose. Medium- to full-bodied, robust malty base with some dark malts and a shy bitter touch, very faint coffee-like hints. Slightly fruity and very, very spicy. Pleasantly hopped, resiny, slightly grassy with earthy notes. Smooth and velvety on the palate - a very nice little beer.
18-Feb-2016-0,33l Flasche. Dunkelbraun, hefetrüb, hellbrauner Schaum. Aroma: Malzig, karamellig. Antrunk malzig, grasig, etwas säuerlich, gegen Ende deutliche Hopfenbitterkeit.

Deep sweet wet dough aroma sounded by malt roast, hints of anis licorice, caramel prunes and chocolate. With faint hints of barrel (rum).
Medium to heavy mouthfeel. well carbonated but dissipates within the malt. Huge explosions of resin, pine, chocolate,licorice, caramelized bread, pepper, hints of orange. 
Starts off medium to heavy in the mouth but as it goes down your throat it dissipates and dries out leaving a brilliant finish with a slight wanted bitterness that balances out the entire experience. I absolutely love it.

33cl bbJul16 from Bierhandlung, merci Martin. - Unctuous Pfirsich caramel pour. Sweet and near-sour aroma, candied lemon and tea leaf like granulated ice tea. Couples the confident whole-cone, near-English orange peel bitterness to heavy caramels with a "sharp" edge. Somehow I imagine part of the bitterness coming from the "Uerige Hefe". Pushes the boundaries of Alt towards the malt body of a Double IPA, without the unnecessary boost. Can Kehrwieder/Wesseloh become the Mikkeller of German traditional brewart? Well-done experiment.

Braun klar im Glas, schöner hellbrauner Schaum, einseitsmalzig süß, aber auch hopfig in der Nase, süß malzig im antrunk, schöne bittere im Abgang, schlanker Körper, sehr trinkbar, netter Wechsel zwischen süße und bittere

Never been a huge fan of the bittersweet Sticke if some regular-strength fresh Alt is handy, but here the sticky-minty-herbal hop aroma and flavor help to make that slog worthwhile, like how a good audiobook turns a routine drive into something that flies by, and you arrive and wonder why its over so quickly. Fun beer. I suspect it has staying power (annually).

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2017 Bottle and tap. Nice brown-amber color with big tan head. Aroma is caramel, citrusy and grassy hops, some plums shine through. Taste is a confusing mix of sticky sweet toffee and grassy hops, towards the end, a clear grassy hop punch. Aftertaste is hoppy as well. Full-bodied. The mixture is actually very special, there?s more to it than what you imagine when you hear "dryhopped Sticke", but it?s hard to describe. This is a good beer.Tap of the second batch, had in February 2017. Still a great beer. Uli "h.ertie" told me this is like old Orval, which I dont really agree, but it definitely is good.

Bottle from the brewery. The nose is nice caramelly fresh with hints of floral hops. The beer starts great fresh malty. Caramel, very dry roasted with nice fresh bitter hops in the aftertaste. Fresh and floral on a dry roasty body. Nice intense fresh bitter aftertaste with lots of fresh floral grassy hops. Nice.

0,33 l swing top bottle 
Some caramel, some roasty notes, citrus, citrus, grass, bread, brown, hazy, minimal head, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation,

0,33 l Uerige swing top bottle bought at Brolters, Bremen. Looks like an Alt with a bigger head in the glass. Hopy nose! Dominating fresh hop at the start. The Alt taste is way behind in the background but present. Increasing malty in the middle part, some sweetness in the background all with the additional hopping. Thought it was more extreme, but okay.

Bottle(333ml): Clear copper to amber coloured, bigger creamy and stable off-white head; dryish caramelly-toasty nose with loads of distinctive herbal hops, almost some piney flavours detectable; solid and dryish bitter-sweet flavour, medium to full bodied, neither tart nor smooth; dry and lingering caramelly-fruity finish with a solid herbal-hoppy "tail". Great, what else

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2016 Natürlich soll bei diesem Bier ganz bewusst der Hopfen im Mittelpunkt stehen, allerdings nimmt dies meiner Meinung nach dem Sticke den Wind aus den Segeln.Malzig-süßer Antrunk, Karamell, Honig. Danach ein sehr langer Mittelteil mit sehr viel Hopfenaroma, Gras, Kräuter. Bittere ist mittel. Zweifelsohne ein gutes Bier, aber ich hätte mehr erwartet.
Klares orange braunes Bier mit einer geringen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, grasig, leicht geröstetes malz. Geschmack sehr hopfig, frisch, grasig bitter, lecker.

Frisch hopfiger Beginn, der bis in den Mittelteil das Aroma bestimmt. Trocken grasig, dann langsam malzig, minimal röstig. Der Hopfen bleibt weiterhin das wichtigste Aroma, ein wenig karamellig. Weich und süffig, das Alt kommt mir zu wenig zur Geltung. 12/9/11/9/12/9
